channel.title: How do I make it so people can't edit my client? (SOLVED)
channel.description: I don't want people to be editing my client so how would I go about that? Like when I download other clients you can't edit them. You can only play them.

item.title: How do I make it so people can't edit my client? (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

add an extra } to client.java so they will get like one hundred errors on client compiler, it’s like an anti-leeech.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make it so people can't edit my client? (SOLVED)

item.title: How do I make it so people can't edit my client? (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @Gnartox Gnartox
item.description:
@Gnartox wrote:

Thanks for the information.

It really doesn’t matter because I didn’t do anything to the client except name swapping really. Not like I can code or anything. I was just wondering how people do it.

item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Native^:

Obfuscate the Java files. Compile. Delete the Java files. Jar the class files. Make it an .exe file for windows users. Idk.

%temp% in run, woot got the code from the exe…
jarring is the best option I guess

item.title: How do I make it so people can't edit my client? (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

People can change it. That’s just the truth. If you remove the java files, they can decompile the class files. If you obfuscate it, they can deobfuscate it.

Read full topic
